definition:
Let $V$ be a vector space over a field $k$, and $x \in V$. Let
$T:V\to V$ be a linear transformation. The *$T$-cyclic subspace
generated by* $x$ is the smallest $T$-invariant subspace which contains
$x$, and is denoted by $Z(x, T)$.

Since $x,T(x),\ldots, T^n(x),\ldots \in Z(x,T)$, we have that
$$W:=\operatorname{span}\lbrace x,T(x),\ldots,T^n(x),\ldots\rbrace \subseteq Z(x,T).$$
On the other hand, since $W$ is $T$-invariant, $Z(x,T)\subseteq W$.
Hence $Z(x,T)$ is the subspace generated by
$x,T(x),\ldots, T^n(x),\ldots$ In other words,
$Z(x,T)=\{p(T)(x) \mid p \in k[X]\}$.

**Remark**. If $Z(x,T)=V$ we say that $x$ is a *cyclic vector* of $T$.
